Photo by Unsplash

This Week in Genesis I’ve got ALL THE THINGS for you including the Genesis 2.2.7 release, a LOT of great new themes, some stellar showcase sites, and a teeny tiny GenesisWP.guide beta tease…

Genesis 2.2.7 released

As I previewed last week, Genesis 2.2.7 is now available to download in a WordPress Genesis site near you. Thanks, as always, to all of those involved.

#GenesisWP 2.2.7 is now available for upgrade in your dashboard.https://t.co/t2EVFGqeJ2

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) March 7, 2016

Themes

First up, another high quality theme from Lauren Gaige of Restored 316 Design, Tickled Pink.

Introducing our newest #genesiswp theme, Tickled Pink, that INCLUDES all the #stockphotography you see! https://t.co/j3QMLT86WW

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) March 9, 2016

Scott Ellis releases a new theme entitled Shoreline.

Elegant new Genesis child theme “Shoreline” amazing work by @WPZombies #genesiswp https://t.co/LpzPvIo7uY

— Scott Ellis (@vsellis) March 4, 2016

Aspire by Wes Straham is now available to buy / download on StudioPress…

Just released Aspire — a new theme from @WesStraham available at StudioPress — https://t.co/wEOqpVbejs #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/hrJbMEzLtL

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) March 9, 2016

…which means *another* free theme for all you Pro Plus StudioPress customers.

Great to see @studiopress consistently putting out great third party themes from the #genesiswp community, seems like a big win for everyone

— Nick Davis (@iamnickdavis) March 9, 2016

ZigZagPress launch their 29th(!) Genesis theme, Formo.

Introducing Formo: Our 29th #genesiswp child theme. Minimalist, ecommere-ready, and super-easy to customize! https://t.co/vhyqlw3qxW

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) March 8, 2016

Theme tease of Summation by Ren V.

#GenesisWP fans, here's Summation, my new child theme. https://t.co/JfxOFWSvOM Dev. is almost finished. #webdesign pic.twitter.com/lM5DkrbEP4

— Ren V. (@CLE_Ren) March 11, 2016

Showcase

Absolutely stellar site by JT Grauke (who also designed the recent and awesome Showcase Pro theme now available on StudioPress) for causevox.com (h/t Brian Gardner).

Easily one of the best looking business designs I’ve ever seen on #genesiswp — https://t.co/WVhXWybUJq props @jtgrauke

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) March 10, 2016

Our friends over at Know The Code (which you should definitely check out btw) launched their new site – knowthecode.io – on Genesis (of course) and Carrie Dils’ popular Utility Pro theme.

Our new website runs on #GenesisWP and a customized version of @cdils Utility Pro.

What do you think of the look?

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) March 9, 2016

One of my favourite designer / developers, Ryan Townley with a site for montagelegal.com (and bonus point if you spotted the Minimography image).

Just launched a new #genesiswp site for Montage Legal Group out of Irvine, CA >>> https://t.co/qOBUr871as pic.twitter.com/iBrIib3luI

— Ryan Townley (@ryantownley) March 7, 2016

The awesome Andrea Whitmer with a new site for the excellently titled fortheloveofbasil.com

Just launched a new custom #genesiswp theme for @LoveofBasil (design by @thefoxandshe) https://t.co/6mCUJBRfI0 pic.twitter.com/0S68pS5GVm

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) March 10, 2016

Happy Joe with a nice site for operationsupplydrop.org

Proud to announce the new launch of https://t.co/p6s1GFVCB3! Design and development by @HappyJoeInc and U.S. Veterans! #genesiswp

— jamesdalman (@jamesdalman) March 10, 2016

Archer Creative with a new site for mamaslearningcorner.com

Our latest site launch, built on #GenesisWP for Mama’s Learning Corner https://t.co/Gaed5hwhIg #homeschool pic.twitter.com/RnkvFwAg4E

— Archer Creative (@Archer_Creative) March 8, 2016

Podcasts

Carrie Dils’ chats with Tom McFarlin over on OfficeHours.fm!

I’m live with @tommcfarlin! Tag your questions with #officefm https://t.co/E768ddmlXd

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) March 10, 2016

Best of the rest

Former GenesisWP.guide interviewee, WP Studio releases a new Genesis testimonial slider plugin.

A good start of the week. Just released a #genesiswp testimonial slider plugin. https://t.co/cGjmkfV6Pd #wordpress #wp

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) March 7, 2016

GenesisWP.guide friend and top supporter Calvin Koepke with a nice article on 5 Principles That Drove the Building of a Genesis Starter Theme (and if you didn’t check out his starter theme yet, grab it now).

5 Principles That Drove the Building of a Genesis Starter Theme: https://t.co/OLBtmndCj1 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/fzZQuLjcz2

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) March 8, 2016

The hugely popular Events Calendar plugin by Modern Tribe now has a Genesis integration plugin (props: Logos Creative).

Mad props to @logoscreative for wrapping our #GenesisWP compatibility content https://t.co/w9Bc9YjnJx into a plugin https://t.co/cKfOywjkBi

— The Events Calendar (@TheEventsCal) March 9, 2016

Nice post (and shoutout for GenesisWP.guide) from Tara Claeys on How to Avoid Shiny Object Syndrome with the Genesis Framework for WordPress.

How to Avoid Shin… https://t.co/bicEXrPtLn #genesiswp @studiopress @cdils @WebSavvyMrkting @GenesisWPguide @srikat @lindseyriel @shaybocks

— Tara Claeys (@design_tlc) March 10, 2016

Sridhar Katakam doing what he does best, publishing more great tutorials, including:

  • How to automatically show a grid of sub Pages on static Pages in Genesis
  • Threaded Comment Numbering in Genesis
  • How to move social icons from header to footer in Glam
  • How to set unique header images for singular pages in Cafe Pro
  • Displaying a grid of Pages’ images (custom field value) in Genesis using Flexible Posts Widget

Jon Barratt with an update to his article on Safely Customizing Genesis WordPress child themes with WP Clips.

Updated article, 'Safely Customizing #GenesisWP child themes with WP Clips' – https://t.co/4xE4gTP2mO pic.twitter.com/epKDTDrXQO

— Jon Barratt (@KrolynStudios) March 8, 2016

Daniel Koskinen shares a Genesis sample theme with Foundation 6.2.

Genesis sample theme with Foundation 6.2: https://t.co/iEzbOPju2C. A starting point for Sass-savvy developers. #foundation6 #genesiswp

— Daniel Koskinen (@danielCK) March 8, 2016

Julia Sydnor is looking for a list of coach websites made with Genesis WordPress.

Compiling a list of #coach websites made with #GenesisWP. If you have one or made one, send me the link.

— Julia Sydnor (@PixelFrau) March 8, 2016

Murray Anderson-Clemence with a tutorial on Adding Advanced Custom Fields Flexible Content Fields to Genesis.

Adding Advanced Custom Fields Flexible Content Fields to Genesis

And finally…

Beta list!

For those brave souls who joined the beta list for GenesisWP.guide a few weeks back you can finally expect something soon as I’ve now started development on version 1.5 (or should it be 2.0?) of GenesisWP.guide…

If you want a hint though, it involves these:

That’s all for this week.

If I missed your awesome thing – and it wasn’t deliberate, I promise – just give it a shout out in the comments below!

PS If you love GenesisWP.guide and want to support what I’m doing please consider following along via email, Facebook and Twitter. It is hugely appreciated.
